newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentina to auction $250 mln in 91-day Letes.
newsitem.headline: Argentina to auction $250 mln in 91-day Letes.

text.p: Argentina's Economy Ministry said Friday it will sell $250 million in 91-day treasury bills (Letes) on September 17 at its monthly bill auction.
Offers are due by 1400 local/1700 GMT on September 17. The sale takes place through Dutch style with settlement due on September 20.

An Economy Ministry official said the issue is in dollars because of the high spread between peso and dollar rates. Only $250 million is being sold this time around because the debt ceiling set earlier in the year is about to be reached, said the official.
At last month's auction, 250 million pesos and $250 dollars of bills were sold.
A further $5.5 million will be offered in non-competitive bids next week.
At last month's auction, 91-day bills denominated in pesos were issued at a cut-off yield of 8.50 percent while 182-day dollar bills attained a cut-off yield of 6.49 percent.
